meanings.definition: Sharpened or stimulated (an appetite or desire)
meanings.sent1: The delicious smell of the food whetted my appetite for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The chef's description of the dish whetted everyone's appetite.
meanings.sent3: The enticing aroma of the freshly baked cookies whetted the dog's appetite too.
meanings.sent4: The suspenseful movie trailer whetted my curiosity about the plot.
meanings.sent5: The challenging puzzle game whetted my desire to solve it.

meanings.sent1: Her whetted enthusiasm for the project was contagious.
meanings.sent2: The students' whetted interest in the topic led to engaging discussions.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's whetted excitement over the new toy was adorable to watch.
meanings.sent4: The whetted anticipation for the concert made the wait worthwhile.
meanings.sent5: His whetted determination to succeed was evident in his focused actions.
